item.title: Report E-2025030101
item.description:
Report E-2025030101

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-05
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 5, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1993 was forked and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the site. ESI personnel inspected the area with R+L personnel and found that the released product had evaporated leaving no residue on the loading dock floor. The damaged pail was placed into one (1) 30-gallon drum and staged onsite for management by the Cura waste team.

item.title: Report X-2025030387
item.description:
Report X-2025030387

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-21
  • City: WINDSOR LOCKS
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking, covered in motor oil. Inner contents revealed: 1 NAPA Commercial AMG Fahrenheit Battery (possibly non spillable, box was soiled badly not sure if there was a label on the outside) 3 bottles of NAPA 5W-30 Full Synthetic Motor Oil, 1 bottle damaged(1qt/946 ml), 1 Filter. Shipment was picked up by the shipper, reporting to FAA as an undeclared.
